event: presented to the hospital with a 1-month history of dyspnoea on exertion
oxygen saturation of 98% on room air
jugular venous pressure elevated at +4 cm
bilateral peripheral oedema to the knees
bilateral crackles at the lung bases
LV internal diameter end diastole 64 mm
LV internal diameter end systole 61 mm
estimated mean right atrial pressure 10–15 mmHg
inferior vena cava (IVC) diameter 17 mm which collapses less than 50% on inspiration
two further masses in the right atrium suspicious for type B thrombi
intracardiac masses had high signal intensity on T1- and T2-weighted sequences
low-signal on first pass imaging following gadolinium administration
delayed enhancement sequences showed near full thickness scars in the lateral and inferior walls
occlusion of the left circumflex artery
occlusion of the right coronary artery
severe stenosis of the mid-left anterior descending artery
repeat cardiac MRI showed complete resolution of intracardiac masses
percutaneous coronary intervention to left anterior descending artery
